snippet: The N.C.A.A. may soon take a more proactive role in using its power to withhold athletic events, an official said.
abstract: NCAA president Mark Emmert says organization may reconsider holding athletic events in states whose laws are seen as discriminatory; NCAA men's basketball tournament Final Four is being held in Houston, where voters repealed equal rights law.
lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. may soon take a more proactive role in using its power to withhold athletic events, an official said.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. May Act More Forcefully Against Laws Seen as Discriminatory
headline.print_headline: N.C.A.A. May Act More Forcefully Against Laws Seen as Discriminatory
